physical_examinations.relevant_findings: General examination revealed a restless woman with pseudobulbar affect. Neurologic examination showed multiple abnormalities, including mild to moderate encephalopathy (Kokmen short test score of 23/38), multifocal myoclonus, postural tremor, appendicular ataxia, and gait ataxia. Muscle strength and reflexes were normal.

physical_examinations.vital_signs: Sodium level of 118 mmol/L (normal 135 –145), after fluid restriction sodium level 129 mmol/L with serum osmolality 262 mOsm/kg (normal 275 –295)
physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Whole blood bismuth level at 948 ng/mL (toxic range), urine bismuth level at 406.5 ng/mL (toxic range).
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 10 weeks follow-up, whole blood bismuth level returned to normal at 9.5 ng/mL, whereas urine level declined to 8.6 ng/mL (normal <50; toxic >200 ng/mL).

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Cognitive function improved to near normal with only very mild difficulty in complex arithmetic. Myoclonus and gait ataxia resolved.
